Description:
S&P Global Commodity InsightsThe Role: Analyst - Oil Markets, Midstream and Downstream (OMD)The Team: This role is in Global Demand Research, a growing part of the Oil Markets, Midstream and Downstream (OMD) under Fuels, Chemicals and Resource Solutions (FRCS) business line at S&P Global Commodity Insights. Members of Global Demand Research interact actively with other research insights and analysts in Asia, the Middle East, Europe, and globally in subject areas such as global oil production, refining, trade flows, generating fuels, future energy outlooks and integrated analytics.The Impact: This position will have major responsibilities in analyzing elements affecting the Africa Continent oil markets with a particular emphasis on oil demand by product in the global context and presenting results in both written reports and client-facing interactions. The position will also have business development and client retention responsibilities for Africa region.What’s in it for you:Analyst focusing on Africa oil market with a focus on short-term oil demand and market dynamics.
Opportunity to work on important regional issues and with a highly experienced team in the industry around the globe.
Develop your career by interacting with cross-commodity teams within the firm.
Expand your perspective by interacting with clients on a regular basis.
Opportunities to work with management of S&P Global Commodity Insights.Responsibilities:Responsible for doing analytics research on short-term Africa oil product demand and market and write monthly reports and spotlights.
Contribute to Global Demand Outlook report.
Be responsible for detailed petroleum product demand forecast for Africa countries.
Understand policy trends affecting the oil sector in Africa.
Deliver ad-hoc spotlight reports based on industrial events and client queries.
Working closely with other members of Global Demand Research, other teams, and Commodity Insights at large.
Interact with customers to answer questions and present oil market outlooks.What We’re Looking For:Minimum four years of experience in refining analytics, energy industry consulting, investment banking, equity research or equivalent professional experience
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in economics, engineering, business administration, or similar field
Excellent communication skills and superb in oral and written English (as most of our communication are done in English internally and externally). Must be able to effectively present forecasts and supporting materials to clients in regular reports, phone calls, emails, and web/live conferences. French language skills will be a big plus.
Innovative and strong problem-solving skills to streamline processes and identify and implement improvements
Expert in Microsoft Excel. At ease using features such as pivot tables, matrix formulas and other advanced Excel functionality
Successful candidates will be able to work well under tight deadlines
Excellent at data mining and data visualization with available software programsGrade/Level (relevant for internal applicants only): 10The Location: Gurgaon, IndiaAbout Company Statement:S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law.
